definitions.definition: the subject of a talk, a piece of writing, a person's thoughts, or an exhibition; a topic.
examples: the theme of the sermon was reverence

definitions.definition: the first major constituent of a clause, indicating the subject-matter, typically being the subject but optionally other constituents, as in “ poor he is not.”
an idea that recurs in or pervades a work of art or literature.
a prominent or frequently recurring melody or group of notes in a composition.
examples: melody, tune, air; Moremotif, leitmotif "the first violin takes up the theme"Moremotif, leitmotif the first violin takes up the theme

definitions.definition: (of music) frequently recurring in or accompanying the beginning and end of a film, play, or musical.
synonyms: jingle "the band played a medley of popular TV show themes"

definitions.definition: a setting given to a leisure venue or activity, intended to evoke a particular country, historical period, culture, etc.
examples: a family fun park with a western theme

definitions.definition: an essay written by a student on an assigned subject.
the stem of a noun or verb; the part to which inflections are added, especially one composed of the root and an added vowel.
any of the twenty-nine provinces in the Byzantine empire.
give a particular setting or ambience to (a venue or activity).
examples: Independence Day was celebrated with special themed menus
